info.title: MLB v3 Stats
info.description: MLB scores, stats, and news API.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, colors, and basic coaching info. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns the teams currently active in the league.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns all stadiums in the league with capacity, dome status, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Home and away teams, date and time, season type and week etc. are included. Also includes gameday information. This includes full stadium information (capacity, lat/long, surface etc.), top-line betting information (spread, moneyline, total), weather conditions, and broadcast information.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes inning and score info. Gameday info includes weather, TV channel etc

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available free agents unattached to a team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available players by team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across a given date, updated live as the game takes place.
get.summary: Player Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all players for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for a given team's players in a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for a all games on a given date, both live and post-game.
get.summary: Team Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all teams (aggregated from all players) for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called for all games on a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called per individual game.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an MLB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the news.
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: This method returns all box scores for a given date, but only returns player stats that have changed in the last X minutes as specified in your API call. By definition this is a live endpoint, not final.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description: Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are: 1, 2 ... all.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Details - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Player Season Stats - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Player Game Stats - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Year of the current season. This value changes at the start of the new league year. For leagues that run over two years, this is the year the season starts, not ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Standings

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: All players' split stats for the season. Split stats are available for left, right, and switch-handed pitchers and hitters.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

parameters.name: split
parameters.description: The desired split of stats. Currently, we support vs. Left/Right/Switch handed pitchers/hitters. Possible values are: L, R and S

get.description: Stat records for a given hitter and a given pitcher, called by PlayerId in both cases.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: hitterid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000031.

parameters.name: pitcherid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000618.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, colors, and coaching info. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: All a given team's players' split stats for the season. Split stats are available for left, right, and switch-handed pitchers and hitters.
get.summary: Player Season Stats Split - by Team

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: All players' stats for the season taken only from their home games.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: All players' stats for the season taken only from their road games.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2017, 2018.

get.description: Returns DFS slates, including eligible games, positions, players and salaries, for a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the slates.
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: For a given game, returns a team's hitting record versus the projected or confirmed starting pitcher for the game in question.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an MLB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Specify a season, a player, and number of games (either an integer or all) to see all of their box score logs. Refreshed after their most recent game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10001365.

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: Game-by-game log of total team statistics for a given season, split up by game (not aggregated into season totals.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: teamid
parameters.description: Unique ID of team. Example 12

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across all teams' games on a given date after each game has concluded.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an MLB game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified date for each game that took place, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for all games on a given date, delivered as each game ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: Returns a simple list of fantasy points and stats for each player for a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.
